Class ConfidenceInterval

extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Detail

      • ConfidenceInterval

        public ConfidenceInterval(double[] values,
                          double confidence)
        Constructor to create the confidence interval. This objects instantiated from this class are immutable, that is, it is not to change the contents of the object after it has been created. The following values are avaiable from the object using it's getter methods.
        • pointEstimate: The point estimate is the mean of the values in the array of values.
        • variance: the variance (i.e. s(n)*s(n)) of the values in the array.
        • stdDev: the standard deviation (s(n) of the values in the array.
        • zeta: the confidence interval half length.
        • cfMin: the minimum value of the confidence interval.
        • CFMax: the maximum value of the confidence interval.

        The confidence interval (and the above values) are determined as follows:

        1. Calculate pointEstimate = sum(values[i])/values.length
        2. Calcudate variance = Sum(values[i] - pointEstimate)^2 / (values.length - 1)
        3. Calculate stdDev = sqrt(stdDev)
        4. Calculate zeta = t(n-1) * variance / sqrt(values.length) where t(n-1) is the stedents t-distribution value computed using the tinv method, n is values.length.
        5. Calculate cfMin = pointEstimate - zeta
        6. Calculate cfMax = pointEstimate + zeta
        Parameters:
        values - - References an array of real values (type double) produced by simulation runs. When the object is created, a copy of the array is made and saved in the object.
        confidence - - The level of confidence for the calculation of the interval, a value between 0 and 1.0.

      • tinv

        public static double tinv(int degFreedom,
                          double conf)
        For providing values of Student's t-distribution values (see Table A1-4 in Modelling and Simulation: Exploring Dynamic System Behaviour, Birta, Arbez, Springer 2nd Edition, 2013).
        Parameters:
        degFreedom - Degrees of Freedom.
        conf - Confidence interval expressed as a value between 0.0 and 1.0.
        Returns:
        The Student t-distribution for the given degrees of freedom and level of confidence.
